name: Z People Trivia Game | People by Surname | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who founded the religion of Zoroastrianism, still practiced in regions of Iran?
questions.explanation:
Zoroaster.

	Zoroastrianism is an extraordinarily old {religion;} Zoroaster was probably born in the 6th or 7th century BC.

questions.text: Name a counter-culture rock star who died in the mid-1990s and whose surname starts with a Z.
Who is the German count with a mode of transportation named after him?
questions.explanation:
F. von Zeppelin

	Born in 1838 (he died in 1917), Count von Zeppelin designed the zeppelin around 1900. It's a rigid 'airship' similar to the blimp.

questions.text: What fictional character swashbuckles his way through Spanish colonial Mexico, fighting corruption and defending the innocent and oppressed population?
questions.explanation:
Zorro.

	Zorro carves a 'Z' wherever he's been.

questions.text: On the subject of fiction, who was king of the ancient Greek pantheon of gods?
questions.explanation:
Zeus.

	The Romans called him Jupiter. Zeus was fond of changing into different shapes in order to woo various women. His wife, Hera, was less than thrilled.

questions.text: "The Onion", a weekly online satirical newspaper, has an unconventional editorial structure. For nearly a hundred years, it claimed to be helmed by the irascible grandson of its founder -- who was apparently over 130 years old when the paper announced he had been rocketed into space in 2000. Who was this reactionary, senile man, whose weekly columns railed against such "evils" as women's suffrage?
questions.explanation:
T. Herman Zweibel

	His weekly column in that paper was the epitome of misanthropy. He was, of course, wholly fictional -- or so we hope!

questions.text: What was the name of F. Scott Fitzgerald's wife?
questions.explanation:
Zelda.

	Zelda was mentally unstable, and spent the last few years of her marriage in a sanatorium.

questions.text: 'J'accuse!' wrote this Frenchman, defending Dreyfus at the turn of the century from French anti-Semitism. This man's name was Emile ____?
This Hungarian-born celebrity, famous for her many husbands and face lifts, has a first name (but not a last name) starting with Z. What IS her name?
questions.explanation:
Zsa Zsa Gabor.

	'Magyar' is Hungarian for 'Hungarian'. Just thought you should know.

questions.text: Finally we have the author of what has been called the first dystopian novel: 'We'. What was the name of this Russian novelist?
questions.explanation:
Yevgeny Zamyatin.

	Georgi Zhukov was in charge of the Soviet Army during World War II. Meanwhile, 'We' -- often said to have inspired George Orwell's '1984' -- is set in a glass-walled city inhabited by nameless, numbered citizens. One day, a mathematician named D-504 discovers that he has an individual soul . . .
